get_rocket_cdn_url.name: get_rocket_cdn_url
get_rocket_cdn_url.summary: Force the rewrite of the image URL
get_rocket_cdn_url.description:
WP Rocket rewrites all the URLs of your images to the CDN URL. However, in rare cases image URLs may not be rewritten, because the theme, or a plugin does not use native WordPress functions to display images.

It is possible to use one of WP Rocket’s own functions to force the rewrite of the image URL in such cases.

rocket_clean_domain.name: rocket_clean_domain
rocket_clean_domain.summary: Clear the cache for your entire website.
rocket_clean_domain.description:
Use the rocket_clean_domain() function when you want to purge a complete domain from the cache.

If your website is multilingual, you can specify the language to be cleared.

rocket_clean_files.name: rocket_clean_files
rocket_clean_files.summary: Use the rocket_clean_files() function when you want to purge some specific pages of the cache.
rocket_clean_files.description: You can use a string, or an array with the URL(s) to purge.

pages.label: pages
pages.description: String or array with the URL(s) to purge

rocket_clean_home.name: rocket_clean_home
rocket_clean_home.summary: Purge your home page from the cache.
rocket_clean_home.description:
Use the rocket_clean_home() function when you want to purge your home page from the cache.

If your website is multilingual, you can specify the language to purge.

WP Rocket supports Polylang and WPML plugins for multilingual content.

rocket_clean_post.name: rocket_clean_post
rocket_clean_post.summary: Purge a post and all “elements” associated to it from the cache
rocket_clean_post.description: Use the rocket_clean_post() function when you want to purge a post and all “elements” associated to it from the cache. Associated elements would be category and tag archive, archives with pagination, etc.

rocket_clean_user.name: rocket_clean_user
rocket_clean_user.summary: Clear the cache of a specific user.
rocket_clean_user.description: The rocket_clean_user($user_id, $lang) function can be used to clear the cache of a specific user when you have logged-in user cache option active.
